update.description:
**Requires** [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/170/a-string-to-uint64_t-hash-function/diff) pull request from Ignition Common.

This pull request implements a factory, where all components self-register. Besides our original discussion, I ended up creating a `Component` base class, as is needed for the `Factory` class.

Components can be created based on strings or ids \(uint64\_t\). I changed they way we were assigning the Ids in the `EntityComponentManager` class. Now, we use `ignition::common::hash64`.
update.title: [A-4] Component factory

**Requires** [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/170/a-string-to-uint64_t-hash-function/diff) pull request from Ignition Common.

Components can be created based on strings or ids \(uint64\_t\). I changed they way we were assigning the Ids in the `EntityComponentManager` class. Now, we use `ignition::common::hash64`.
update.title: [A-4] Component factory

**Requires** [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/170/a-string-to-uint64_t-hash-function/diff) pull request from Ignition Common.

content.raw: My understanding is that it is preferred to use `""` for internal headers. I think all headers here could use that. I do remember a conversation we had a while back with @mxgrey about how it didn't really matter because of the way we handle things in Ignition, so I was wondering if it was because of that.
content.html: My understanding is that it is preferred to use "" for internal headers. I think all headers here could use that. I do remember a conversation we had a while back with @mxgrey about how it didn't really matter because of the way we handle things in Ignition, so I was wondering if it was because of that.

content.raw: I changed it for not having one with `<>` and the other with `""` when both headers belong to ignition Gazebo. Is there any reason for keeping it as it was originally?
content.html: I changed it for not having one with <> and the other with "" when both headers belong to ignition Gazebo. Is there any reason for keeping it as it was originally?

content.raw: Yup, will update.
content.html: Yup, will update.

content.raw: You are correct, I’ll modify.
content.html: You are correct, I’ll modify.

content.raw: Not sure, maybe @caguero knows why?
content.html: Not sure, maybe @caguero knows why?

content.raw: I left some comments, but I think this is a good start for us to iterate on top of. I should mention here that I'm working on a PR to go on top of this one that will combine `Component`, `SimpleWrapper` and `TagWrapper` into a class.
content.html: I left some comments, but I think this is a good start for us to iterate on top of. I should mention here that I'm working on a PR to go on top of this one that will combine Component, SimpleWrapper and TagWrapper into a class.

content.raw:
It feels that this `New` function is asking for duplicate information. If we need to pass the precise type `T` as a template, couldn't we deduce `_type` from that?

Something like:

`auto type = EntityComponentManager::ComponentType<T>();`
content.html:
It feels that this New function is asking for duplicate information. If we need to pass the precise type T as a template, couldn't we deduce _type from that?

Something like:

auto type = EntityComponentManager::ComponentType<T>();

content.raw: It would be good to document all the `tparam`s
content.html: It would be good to document all the tparams

content.raw:
Gotta update the documentation:

`include/ignition/gazebo/EntityComponentManager.hh:      /// function that is equivalent to typeid(ComponentTypeT).hash_code().`
content.html:
Gotta update the documentation:

include/ignition/gazebo/EntityComponentManager.hh: /// function that is equivalent to typeid(ComponentTypeT).hash_code().

content.raw: These could be static member variables?
content.html: These could be static member variables?

content.raw: Missing documentation for `_desc`
content.html: Missing documentation for _desc

content.raw: Just curious if the `SimpleWrapper` include was changed from `""` to `<>` on purpose
content.html: Just curious if the SimpleWrapper include was changed from "" to <> on purpose

content.raw: I think none of the new headers are needed here, this may be a leftover from when everything was `Factory`
content.html: I think none of the new headers are needed here, this may be a leftover from when everything was Factory

content.raw:
I built this branch on Linux with `clang7` and , and I’m getting some more consistent segfaults.

    #0  0x00007fffbfd33680 in ?? ()
    #1  0x00007ffff7a77024 in std::_Function_base::~_Function_base (this=0x775048) at /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/std_function.h:257
    #2  0x00007ffff7a76fe5 in std::function<std::unique_ptr<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component, std::default_delete<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component> > ()>::~function() (this=0x775048) at /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/std_functi
    on.h:128
    #3  0x00007ffff7a76fc9 in std::pair<unsigned long const, std::function<std::unique_ptr<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component, std::default_delete<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component> > ()> >::~pair() (this=0x775040) at /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../
    include/c++/8/bits/stl_pair.h:198
    ...
    #11 0x00007ffff7a76ca5 in std::map<unsigned long, std::function<std::unique_ptr<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component, std::default_delete<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component> > ()>, std::less<unsigned long>, std::allocator<std::pair<unsigned long const, std::function<s
    td::unique_ptr<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component, std::default_delete<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component> > ()> > > >::~map() (this=0x7ffff7dd3e08 <ignition::common::SingletonT<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Factory>::GetInstance()::t+56>) at /usr/bin/../lib/gcc
    /x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/stl_map.h:300
    #12 0x00007ffff7a76a51 in ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Factory::~Factory (this=0x7ffff7dd3dd0 <ignition::common::SingletonT<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Factory>::GetInstance()::t>) at /home/michael/repos/ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Factory.hh:39

‌

My initial thought is that it looks like _maybe_ the memory that the function was in is no longer valid, so calling the destructor of the `std::function` causes the segfault.
content.html:
I built this branch on Linux with clang7 and , and I’m getting some more consistent segfaults.

#0  0x00007fffbfd33680 in ?? ()
#1  0x00007ffff7a77024 in std::_Function_base::~_Function_base (this=0x775048) at /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/std_function.h:257
#2  0x00007ffff7a76fe5 in std::function<std::unique_ptr<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component, std::default_delete<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component> > ()>::~function() (this=0x775048) at /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/std_functi
on.h:128
#3  0x00007ffff7a76fc9 in std::pair<unsigned long const, std::function<std::unique_ptr<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component, std::default_delete<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component> > ()> >::~pair() (this=0x775040) at /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../
include/c++/8/bits/stl_pair.h:198
...
#11 0x00007ffff7a76ca5 in std::map<unsigned long, std::function<std::unique_ptr<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component, std::default_delete<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component> > ()>, std::less<unsigned long>, std::allocator<std::pair<unsigned long const, std::function<s
td::unique_ptr<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component, std::default_delete<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Component> > ()> > > >::~map() (this=0x7ffff7dd3e08 <ignition::common::SingletonT<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Factory>::GetInstance()::t+56>) at /usr/bin/../lib/gcc
/x86_64-linux-gnu/8/../../../../include/c++/8/bits/stl_map.h:300
#12 0x00007ffff7a76a51 in ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Factory::~Factory (this=0x7ffff7dd3dd0 <ignition::common::SingletonT<ignition::gazebo::v0::components::Factory>::GetInstance()::t>) at /home/michael/repos/ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Factory.hh:39

‌

My initial thought is that it looks like maybe the memory that the function was in is no longer valid, so calling the destructor of the std::function causes the segfault.

content.raw: Thanks! Class updated to a singleton.
content.html: Thanks! Class updated to a singleton.

content.raw: Code updated: `Factory`is a singleton now. I added some of the infrastructure for embedding the `id` and `name` in this pull request but is not fully enabled as it requires to update lots of tests.
content.html: Code updated: Factoryis a singleton now. I added some of the infrastructure for embedding the id and name in this pull request but is not fully enabled as it requires to update lots of tests.

content.raw: Totally agreed but if we use the embedded `id` we might need to update a lot of tests.
content.html: Totally agreed but if we use the embedded id we might need to update a lot of tests.

content.raw: My reservation with this \(vs embedding the hash in the object\) is that this will be evaluated at run-time, rather than compile-time.
content.html: My reservation with this (vs embedding the hash in the object) is that this will be evaluated at run-time, rather than compile-time.
